quest.name: Wright for the Job
journal:
 Quest Sync
Eueliss awaits a decision from Sai-Lewq.

After thanking you again for your patience, Eueliss prompts Sai-Lewq for a decision regarding the role of mayor. The old man then shares the reason behind his lingering reluctance: he believes that his hesitation in ringing the warning bell caused many to die needlessly to the marauding sin eater. Hearing you speak of vengeance, however, appears to provide some relief to his all-consuming guilt. It seems he is ready to return to the village.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

You rejoin Eueliss in Wright, and she explains that there is something more she would show you and Sai-Lewq. As your last errand for Eueliss, you are to find the old man and bid him accompany you to the barley fields.
You inform Sai-Lewq of Eueliss's wishes, then set out to the aforementioned meeting place at the front of the village.

You approach Eueliss in the fields, and she proudly presents the crop of barley she has been tending in her late father's absence. She speaks of his dream to revive the village─of the swaying stalks of barley to one day be used to brew a barrel of traditional Wright ale. Moved by her determination, Sai-Lewq at last decides to take up the mantle of mayor, and work alongside Eueliss to restore Wright to some semblance of its former prosperity. Eueliss watches as the old man leaves, then her gaze settles upon you...

Eueliss thanks you once more for your unfailing cooperation. Although the people of Wright must live with the sorrows of the past, she is nevertheless resolved to see her village forge a happier path for the future.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Thank you for your patience, Forename. Sai-Lewq still appears to be wrestling with his thoughts, but perhaps we can help him come to a decision.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Sir, I don't mean to press you, but might you have arrived at an answer to my proposal?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Ah, not exactly, no. There is another matter I have yet to reconcile...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Would you mind sharing this matter with us?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: ...Well, it goes back to the day that the eater attacked the village. I was taking my turn as lookout here at Stonegazer...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: It's a duty we take very seriously. They say when the tower was originally built, in the time before the Flood, they were worried about dwarves and mountain bandits, but these days...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Yes, there is far worse prowling around. And I failed to spot it.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: The sin eater which came that day did not appear as the other monstrosities I have seen...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: From a distance, it simply looked like a person. I wanted to be sure before I rang the warning bell, but I waited too long─many who could have fled died because of my hesitation.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: How could a man of such faulty judgment ever serve you as mayor? What comfort can I offer those whose loved ones were needlessly slain? None! Not whilst the abomination itself yet roams free to kill again!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: You...you and Granson killed it!? You slew Dikaiosyne!?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Then vengeance has been done. I thank you... Wright thanks you...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I-I can scarce believe it! You've avenged the souls of our people─of my father─and here I've been dragging you across the countryside like a common guardsman...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: ...You would take vengeance on our behalf? That is good, for we were powerless before its might. Should the eater show its cursed face again, then I pray you are as strong as you appear.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I know nothing of the roads you have walked or the battles you have fought, so I can but echo what Sai-Lewq has said. Our prayers will be for your victory.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Well, sir, you've heard Forename's words. Talk of vengeance aside, I do not believe the villagers, either living or dead, hold you responsible for the actions of that monster.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: And yet I cannot fault you for wanting to remain distant. Pray forgive me for pestering you so...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Nay, 'tis I who should beg forgiveness. Though you've lost as much as anyone, I left you to shoulder the burden of leadership alone.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: All will be well with you back among us again. Come, let us return to the village─as I've said, it's unsafe to linger out here for long!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Forename. One last escort back to Wright, if you would?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: I am grateful for your understanding...and the flowers you brought. My wife would have very much approved of the selection.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: My thanks for your protection, Forename, not to mention your unfailing patience.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: It is my hope that now Sai-Lewq has unburdened his mind to us, his heart will be that tiniest bit lighter.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I, for one, feel ready to face another day. After all, I have my friends and neighbors here to help me face it.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Ah, there was one last thing I wanted to show both you and Sai-Lewq...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: It has to do with Wright's traditional industry, if you were interested in taking a look?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Oh, good! I was worried you'd had enough of me!

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: My last errand for you, then, will be to have a word with Sai-Lewq, and bring him to the barley fields at the front of the village.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I'll be there tending to the crops until you arrive!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: What is my place now in all this...?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I am grateful for your understanding...and the flowers you brought. My wife would have very much approved of the selection.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Now, was there something you wished to discuss with me?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: ...And Eueliss wants me there as well, does she? We had best head over to the fields, then.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: This is what I wanted to show you. This barley crop right here!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: This...this was your father's plot, wasn't it? And you've been tending to it in his absence?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Every single day. I wanted to see his plans come true.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: His plans...?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Yes, he dreamed of restoring things to how the history books said they once were─before the Flood ruined everything.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Our village has long been known as a place of artisans. Even the name, “Wright,” is a nod to all the craftsmen that once made their home here.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: In years gone by, it's said a line of Talos would stretch down the road, arms bearing lumber, and the shipyard would echo with the calls of shipwrights hard at work. And when the day was done, they would gather here to share an ale in the village.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: My father, he... He'd hoped to brew that traditional Wright ale with the barley from this crop─to one day tap a barrel with his family and dear friends, and raise a toast...<sob>...to the future...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Sai-Lewq, Forename...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Will you raise a mug with me when that day comes?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Of course I will...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Ah, but my dear girl, the land here does not nourish the crops as it once did. I fear it will be some time ere you'll have barley fit for the ale you have in mind.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: In the meantime, will you help me with the rest of Cliftol's plans?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: The rest...?

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: He wanted things the way they once were, did he not? Then we must first recover from the tragedy which was visited upon us.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: There is no simple solution, but I mean to do what I can to lead our community out of this mire of pain and grief...

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: ...Assuming you are still willing to have me as mayor?

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Yes! Of course, sir, thank you!

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: I was set to live out the rest of my life in denial, but you and Eueliss have opened the eyes of this old fool to what needs to be done.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: And for that, you have my thanks.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: Now, I had best get to work! I have folk to talk to and plans to make. When you're finished here, Eueliss, I should appreciate your assistance.

dialogue.name: SAILEWQ
dialogue.text: How long has it been since I've set foot in these fields...

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: Well, Forename, I think this is where we finally part ways. Thank you again for all you have done for us.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: The people of Wright will go on, even under the weight of our sorrow.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: It might not happen this day or the next, but together we'll find ways to make things better─to recapture the prosperity this village once had.

dialogue.name: EUELISS
dialogue.text: I look forward to when you next visit. With any luck, I'll be waiting to put a frothing mug of Wright-brewed ale in your hand!
